example.text: Megacaryocytes are submitted to an endomical cycle consisting of a S phase interrupted by a vacuum, during which Tg Xist RNA enters the mitosis, but has the ability to skip the Xico ectopic.
Megakaryocytes are submitted to an endomyotic cycle, which consists of a S phase skipped by a gap, during which Tg RNA Xista enter mitosis, but may have pulsed the Xico ectopic.
Megakaryocytes are submitted to an endomytic cycle, which consists of a S phase interrupted by a gap, during which Xic RNA is skipped by Xista RNA.
Megakaryocytes are submitted to an endomytic cycle, which consists of a S phase interrupted by a gap, during which the Xico ectopic has been skipped by Tg RNA Xista.
Megakaryotic Tg RNA Xista are skipped to an endometic cycle, consisting of a phase S interrupted by a vacuum, during which the Xico ectopic may have been supplanted by cells.

Tg RNA Xist covers the autosomal but, as we have predicted, does not skip the Xico ectopic, raising the possibility that X chromosome domains escape from inactivation, excluding the A0 binding (Xist RNA).
